## Purpose
Rich library JSON pretty-printing and syntax highlighting module. Provides a renderable JSON class for terminal display with configurable formatting and optional syntax highlighting.

## Core Components

**JSON Class (L9-102)**
- Primary renderable for displaying formatted JSON in Rich console applications
- Constructor `__init__` (L25-51): Accepts JSON string, parses/reformats it, applies syntax highlighting
- Alternative constructor `from_data` (L53-99): Creates JSON object directly from Python data structures
- Rich protocol implementation `__rich__` (L101-102): Returns formatted Text object for rendering

## Key Dependencies
- `json.loads/dumps` (L2): Standard library JSON parsing/serialization
- `.text.Text` (L5): Rich Text object for formatted output
- `.highlighter.JSONHighlighter/NullHighlighter` (L6): Syntax highlighting components

## Configuration Parameters
All methods support extensive JSON serialization options:
- `indent`: Indentation control (spaces/tabs)
- `highlight`: Enable/disable syntax highlighting  
- `skip_keys`: Skip non-basic type keys
- `ensure_ascii`: ASCII escaping control
- `check_circular`: Circular reference detection
- `allow_nan`: NaN/Infinity handling
- `default`: Custom serialization callback
- `sort_keys`: Dictionary key sorting

## Text Rendering Properties
Both constructors set consistent Text object properties (L50-51, L97-98):
- `no_wrap = True`: Prevents line wrapping
- `overflow = None`: No overflow handling

## CLI Interface (L105-139)
Standalone command-line JSON pretty-printer:
- Accepts file path or stdin input (`-` argument)
- Configurable indentation via `--indent/-i` flag
- Error handling for file read operations
- Uses Rich Console for output with soft wrapping

## Architecture Notes
- Follows Rich's renderable pattern via `__rich__` protocol
- Immediate parsing/formatting in constructor (no lazy evaluation)
- Consistent parameter interface between constructor methods
- Clean separation between JSON processing and highlighting concerns
